info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 20 at 3:17AM PDT until July 22 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM PDT SATURDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with temperatures up to 112 degrees expected. For the Excessive Heat Watch, dangerously hot conditions with temperatures up to 110 degrees possible. In addition, warm overnight low temperatures will not add much relief from the heat. * WHERE...The Antelope and adjacent foothill areas. * WHEN...For the Excessive Heat Warning, from 10 AM this morning to 9 PM PDT Saturday. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from Saturday evening through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
